• Package
    • __SCHEMA__
    • validate
    • __getattr__
    • __setattr__
   1 import six
   2 
   3 from .base import DataView
   4 
   5 
   6 class Package(DataView):
   7     """A package requirement specified in a Pipfile.
   8 
   9     This is the base class of variants appearing in either `[packages]` or
  10     `[dev-packages]` sections of a Pipfile.
  11     """
  12     # The extra layer is intentional. Cerberus does not allow top-level keys
  13     # to have oneof_schema (at least I can't do it), so we wrap this in a
  14     # top-level key. The Requirement model class implements extra hacks to
  15     # make this work.
  16     __SCHEMA__ = {
  17         "__package__": {
  18             "oneof_type": ["string", "dict"],
  19         },
  20     }
  21 
  22     @classmethod
  23     def validate(cls, data):
  24         # HACK: Make this validatable for Cerberus. See comments in validation
  25         # side for more information.
  26         return super(Package, cls).validate({"__package__": data})
  27 
  28     def __getattr__(self, key):
  29         if isinstance(self._data, six.string_types):
  30             if key == "version":
  31                 return self._data
  32             raise AttributeError(key)
  33         try:
  34             return self._data[key]
  35         except KeyError:
  36             pass
  37         raise AttributeError(key)
  38 
  39     def __setattr__(self, key, value):
  40         if key == "_data":
  41             super(Package, self).__setattr__(key, value)
  42         elif key == "version" and isinstance(self._data, six.string_types):
  43             self._data = value
  44         else:
  45             self._data[key] = value
